question_text:
A cookie factory puts $\frac{1}{2}$ of a barrel of flour into each batch of cookies. How much flour will the factory use for 10 batches?

Write your answer as a fraction or as a whole or mixed number.
___ barrels
solution: The factory will use 10 times $\frac{1}{2}$ of a barrel of flour.
Multiply: $10 \times \frac{1}{2} = ?$
Write 10 as an improper fraction: $10 = \frac{10}{1}$.
Multiply the numerators and multiply the denominators: $\frac{10}{1} \times \frac{1}{2} = \frac{10 \times 1}{1 \times 2} = \frac{5}{1}$.
Simplify the product: $\frac{5}{1} = 5$.\nThe factory will use 5 barrels of flour.

Multiply the numerators and multiply the denominators: $\frac{28}{1} \times \frac{1}{31} = \frac{28 \times 1}{1 \times 31} = \frac{28}{31}$.
Simplify the product: $\frac{28}{31} = \frac{28}{31}$.\nThe factory will use \frac2831 barrels of flour.

Simplify the product: $\frac{10}{23} = \frac{10}{23}$.\nThe factory will use \frac1023 barrels of flour.
